title: Listen: Immigration plans face off in Senate
text:
In today's HillCast PM View, your daily evening update on what went down in Washington:

The Senate finally starts to move on immigration, but a number of plans are still competing; the GOP is begging certain candidates who said "no" to a Senate run to reconsider; and the White House is sitting on LGBT protection regulations. Host Niv Elis talks to The Hill’s Jordain Carney, Scott Wong and Lydia Wheeler about what happened today on Capitol Hill.

Subscribe now: Apple Podcasts | Soundcloud | Stitcher | Google Play | TuneIn
